title: Frank Lowy retires to live in Israel
text:
His youngest son, Steven, lives in Sydney.

Eight of Sir Frank’s 11 grandchildren live in the US, as do six of his great-grandchildren.

Sir Frank was born in a small town in Slovakia and survived the Holocaust in Hungary. At 15, as a refugee, he boarded an illegal boat for Palestine.

There he fought in the War of Independence and witnessed the birth of the new State of Israel.

The surviving members of his family had moved to Sydney and he missed them. At the age of 21, he joined them.

Before his 30th birthday, he and fellow Hungarian émigré, John Saunders, had founded Westfield and taken it public.

Sir Frank always said he would retire at the age of 60 but as that approached, he pushed it out to 65. Thereafter, he set no date.

Advertisement

At 80, he shifted from executive to non-executive chairman of Westfield and remained so until the company was sold to the French commercial real-estate company Unibail Rodamco for $33 billion.

In December 2017, at an investiture at Windsor Castle, he was appointed a Knight Bachelor in the Queen’s Birthday Honours List.

Sir Frank puts his success down to never giving up.

“The word ‘no’ is not for me. I don’t hear it. You always have to try again and again,” he told Channel 12.

description: The Westfield co-founder, and No. 7 on the Financial Review Rich List, said: "I feel that I'm home."
